intro: Oxytropis chrysotricha, commonly known as golden beard vetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant has small, trifoliate leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Oxytropis chrysotricha is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
